comments.body: It isn’t clear to me that removing the receivers is the right thing to do. I guess you want to prevent people from making a proposal that they can accept themselves? Maybe not a super useful thing to do but I also don’t see why it’s problematic. In any case, this deserves to be mentioned in the docs.

Isn't the idea that you split the set of signatories of the proposed asset into two subsets. The _proposers_ which need to sign the proposal and the _receivers_. Here, we just compute the proposers from the signatories of the proposed asset and receivers. This makes a lot of sense to me.
Thanks for the explanation, that does make sense to me as well but it should still be pointed out in the docs.

@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+-- Copyright (c) 2019 The DAML Authors. All rights reserved.
+-- SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+
+-- A generic proposal workflow using generic templates.
+daml 1.2
+module Proposal where
+
+import DA.List
+
+-- start proposal body
+template Template t => Proposal t
+  with
+    asset : t
+    receivers : [Party]
+  where
+    signatory (signatory asset \\ receivers)
